						TestNG

* TestNG is an Automation Testing Framework 

* NG -----> Next Generation

* Inspird from J-Unit Which uses Annotations

* Overcomes disadvantages of JUnit 

* Works under TDD Techniques

* TDD -----> Test Driven Development

* In TDD, create the test cases first then write the code for each test cases


Advantages of TestNG :

* Reports are generated by default.

* Meaningful and easily understandable annotations

* Parallel Testing is possible

* Grouping, Prioritization and data parameterization as an added advantage

* Easy to manage the code.





Hierarchy Of TestNG:


1. Simple Annotations : STCM - MCTS


				@BeforeSuite

				@BeforeTest

				@BeforeClass

				@BeforeMethod

				@Test

				@AfterMethod

				@AfterClass

				@AfterTest

				@AfterSuite


		An Annotation is a tag which provides the information about the execution in the test Script



Features Associated with TestNG Framework :-

		Annotations

		Priority test

		Invocation Count Test

		Description Test

		ExpectedException Test

		Ignore Test

		Group Test

		Parameterized Test

		Timeout Test

		Dependency Test

		Fail Test

		Report

		Data Provider

		Parallel Test

		Cross Browser Test

		Assert

		Retry Analyzer Test

		JUnit Test( Cucumber )

		
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


TestNG Example:

	For Amazon --->

			Setup		 ---> @BeforeSuite

			Browser Launch	---> @BeforeTest

			Enter Url		---> @BeforeClass

			Login		---> @BeforeMethod

			Search Laptop	---> @Test

			Search Mobile	---> @Test

			Verify Home Page	---> @AfterMethod
				Assert - Expected vs Actual - AssertionError

			Logout		---> @AfterClass

			Close Browser	---> @BeforeTest

			Delete Cookies	---> @AfterSuite
			

























		

		

		





















Priority Test :

	Means giving the priority to the @Test

	Priority starts from -ve to 0 to +ve.

	If priority number is same the priority goes depends upon ASCII Values
